batch:job.batch:description: Gets a Darwin Core Archive from a web-accessible URI, unpacks it in a local folder, reads the metadata, then imports the content

batch:step.batch:description: Set the temporary file names
Get the darwin core archive
Cleanup the resources
Unzip the archive to a temporary directory
Read the metadata from the archive and figure out how to interpret the files
Mark any existing taxa associated with this resource
Process the core file containing the taxa but only check the taxa, don't modify or create taxa
Process the core file containing the taxa, creating and modifying where neccessary
Process the core file containing the taxa, creating taxonomic links only
Delete the taxa which appear in the database, but not in the archive
Build the scientific-names suggester index
Mark the description records we expect to be present in this archive (based on what we have previously harvested)
Process the extension file containing the descriptions
Delete descriptions related to this resource which exist in the database but not in the archive
Build the characteristic suggester index
Mark the term records we expect to be present in this archive (based on what we have previously harvested)
Process the extension file containing the terms
Delete the terms which we expected to be present in the archive but which were absent
Index the terms associated with this job
Mark the image records we expect to be present in this archive (based on what we have previously harvested)
Process the extension file containing the images
Mark the taxa who need to be re-indexed due to image 'bubble-up'
Delete the images which we expected to be present in the archive but which were absent
Mark the reference records we expect to be present in this archive (based on what we have previously harvested)
Process the extension file containing the references
Delete the references which we expected to be present in the archive but which were absent
Mark the identifier records we expect to be present in this archive (based on what we have previously harvested)
Process the extension file containing the identifiers
Delete the identifiers which we expected to be present in the archive but which were absent
Process the extension file containing the identifications
Delete the identifications which we expected to be present in the archive but which were absent
Mark the distribution records we expect to be present in this archive (based on what we have previously harvested)
Process the extension file containing the distribution
Delete the distribution which we expected to be present in the archive but which were absent
Mark the measurement or fact records we expect to be present in this archive (based on what we have previously harvested)
Process the extension file containing the distribution
Delete the measurement or facts which we expected to be present in the archive but which were absent
Mark the vernacular name records we expect to be present in this archive (based on what we have previously harvested)
Process the extension file containing the vernacular names
Delete the vernacular names which we expected to be present in the archive but which were absent
Build the common-name suggester index
Mark the type and specimen records we expect to be present in this archive (based on what we have previously harvested)
Process the extension file containing types and specimens
Delete the types and specimens which we expected to be present in the archive but which were absent
Index the types and specimens associated with this job
Index the taxa associated with this job
Delete the annotations no longer associated with this job
Cleanup the resources
Delete the annotations no longer associated with this job
Cleanup the resources
